dt: {bc}to perform work or fulfill duties regularly for wages or salary
{bc}to perform or carry through a task requiring sustained effort or continuous repeated operations

dt.t: {wi}worked{/wi} all day over a hot stove

dt: {bc}to exert oneself physically or mentally especially in sustained effort for a purpose or under compulsion or necessity
{bc}to function or operate according to plan or design
{bc}to produce a desired effect or result {bc}{sx|succeed||}
{bc}to make way slowly and with difficulty {bc}move or progress laboriously
{bc}to move slightly in relation to another part
{bc}to get into a specified condition by slow or imperceptible movements
{bc}to be in agitation or restless motion
{bc}to permit of being {a_link|worked} {bc}react in a specified way to being worked
{bc}to set or keep in motion, operation, or activity {bc}cause to operate or produce
{bc}to solve (a problem) by reasoning or calculation
{bc}to control or guide the operation of

dt.t: switches are {wi}worked{/wi} from a central tower

dt: {bc}to carry on an operation or perform a job through, at, in, or along

dt.t: a sportscaster hired to {wi}work{/wi} the game

dt: {bc}to greet and talk with in a friendly way in order to ingratiate oneself or achieve a purpose
{bc}to pay for or achieve with labor or service

dt.t: {wi}worked{/wi} my way up in the company

dt: {bc}to prepare for use by stirring or kneading
{bc}to bring into a desired form by a gradual process of cutting, hammering, scraping, pressing, or stretching
{bc}to fashion or create a useful or desired product by expending labor or exertion on {bc}{sx|forge||}, {sx|shape||}
{bc}to get (oneself or an object) into or out of a condition or position by gradual stages

dt.t: we can {wi}work{/wi} it so that you can take your vacation

dt: {bc}to practice trickery or cajolery on for some end

dt.t: {wi}worked{/wi} the management for a free ticket

et: Middle English {it}werken, worken{/it}, from Old English {it}wyrcan{/it}; akin to Old English {it}weorc{/it}
shortdef: to perform work or fulfill duties regularly for wages or salary
to perform or carry through a task requiring sustained effort or continuous repeated operations
to exert oneself physically or mentally especially in sustained effort for a purpose or under compulsion or necessity

dt: {bc}activity in which one exerts strength or faculties to do or perform something:
{bc}activity that a person engages in regularly to earn a livelihood
{bc}a specific task, duty, function, or assignment often being a part or phase of some larger activity
{bc}sustained physical or mental effort to overcome obstacles and achieve an objective or result
{bc}something produced or accomplished by effort, exertion, or exercise of skill

dt.t: this book is the {wi}work{/wi} of many hands

dt: {bc}something produced by the exercise of creative talent or expenditure of creative effort {bc}artistic production

dt.t: an early {wi}work{/wi} by a major writer

dt: {bc}something that results from a particular manner or method of {a_link|working}, operating, or devising
{bc}something that results from the use or fashioning of a particular material
{bc}structures in engineering (such as docks, bridges, or embankments) or mining (such as shafts or tunnels)
{bc}a fortified structure (such as a fort, earthen barricade, or trench)

ins.spl: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a place where industrial labor is carried on {bc}{sx|plant||}, {sx|factory||}
{bc}the working or moving parts of a mechanism

dt.t: the whole {wi}works{/wi}, rod, reel, tackle box, went overboard

dt: {bc}the transference of energy that is produced by the motion of the point of application of a force and is measured by multiplying the force and the displacement of its point of application in the line of action

dt.t: sand dunes are the {wi}work{/wi} of sea and wind
wait for time to do its healing {wi}work{/wi}

dt: {bc}the material or piece of material that is operated upon at any stage in the process of manufacture
{bc}in process of preparation, development, or completion

pt: {sc}work{/sc} {sc}labor{/sc} {sc}travail{/sc} {sc}toil{/sc} {sc}drudgery{/sc} {sc}grind{/sc} mean activity involving effort or exertion. {sc}work{/sc} may imply activity of body, of mind, of a machine, or of a natural force.
{sc}labor{/sc} applies to physical or intellectual work involving great and often strenuous exertion.

pt.t: farmers demanding fair compensation for their {it}labor{/it}

pt: {sc}travail{/sc} is bookish for labor involving pain or suffering.

pt.t: years of {it}travail{/it} were lost when the house burned
his lot would be years of back-breaking {it}toil{/it}
an editorial job with a good deal of {it}drudgery{/it}

pt: {sc}grind{/sc} implies labor exhausting to mind or body.

{sc}work{/sc} {sc}employment{/sc} {sc}occupation{/sc} {sc}calling{/sc} {sc}pursuit{/sc} {sc}métier{/sc} {sc}business{/sc} mean a specific sustained activity engaged in especially in earning one's living. {sc}work{/sc} may apply to any purposeful activity whether remunerative or not.
{sc}employment{/sc} implies work for which one has been engaged and is being paid by an employer.

pt.t: your {it}employment{/it} with this firm is hereby terminated

pt: {sc}occupation{/sc} implies work in which one engages regularly especially as a result of training.

pt.t: his {it}occupation{/it} as a trained auto mechanic

pt: {sc}calling{/sc} applies to an occupation viewed as a vocation or profession.
{sc}pursuit{/sc} suggests a trade, profession, or avocation followed with zeal or steady interest.

pt.t: her family considered medicine the only proper {it}pursuit{/it}

pt: {sc}métier{/sc} implies a calling or pursuit for which one believes oneself to be especially fitted.

pt.t: acting was my one and only {it}métier{/it}

pt: {sc}business{/sc} suggests activity in commerce or the management of money and affairs.

et: Middle English {it}werk, work{/it}, from Old English {it}werc, weorc{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}werc{/it} work, Greek {it}ergon{/it}, Avestan {it}varəzem{/it} activity
shortdef: activity in which one exerts strength or faculties to do or perform something:
activity that a person engages in regularly to earn a livelihood
a specific task, duty, function, or assignment often being a part or phase of some larger activity
suitable or styled for wear while working

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}a plan or method to circumvent a problem (as in computer software) without eliminating it

shortdef: a plan or method to circumvent a problem (as in computer software) without eliminating it

dt: {bc}a short-term group project in which individuals from one or more religious organizations volunteer their labor

shortdef: a camp for workers: such as
a short-term group project in which individuals from one or more religious organizations volunteer their labor

shortdef: a belief in work as a moral good : a set of values centered on the importance of doing work and reflected especially in a desire or determination to work hard

dt: {bc}a farm on which persons guilty of minor law violations are confined

shortdef: a farm on which persons guilty of minor law violations are confined

dt: {bc}to insert or cause to penetrate by repeated or continued effort
{bc}to interpose or insinuate gradually or unobtrusively

shortdef: to insert or cause to penetrate by repeated or continued effort
to interpose or insinuate gradually or unobtrusively

dt: {bc}a product of one of the fine arts
{bc}a painting or sculpture of high artistic quality
{bc}something giving high aesthetic satisfaction to the viewer or listener

something giving high aesthetic satisfaction to the viewer or listener
